name: Shutterstock
description: Shutterstock provides a global marketplace for licensing royalty-free images, videos, and music for creative projects.
longDescription: Shutterstock is a leading platform offering an extensive library of over 310 million royalty-free stock photos, videos, vectors, illustrations, and music tracks for creative professionals and businesses. Founded in 2003 by Jon Oringer, it connects creators with customers worldwide, enabling seamless content licensing for use in marketing, advertising, and media. The platform supports a diverse contributor network, ensuring a wide variety of high-quality visuals. Shutterstock also integrates advanced technologies like AI and machine learning for tools such as image discovery and editing. Its mission is to empower creators and brands to execute their vision with confidence, supported by straightforward pricing and licensing models. The platform serves everyone from individual designers to large corporations through subscriptions and à la carte options.
features: Access to over 310 million royalty-free images, including photos, vectors, and illustrations, for diverse creative needs.
A library of 17 million HD and 4K video clips to enhance marketing campaigns and cinematic productions.
Music tracks and sound effects available for licensing to complement visual content in multimedia projects.
Advanced search and discovery tools, like Shutterstock Instant, to quickly find relevant high-quality content.
Mobile apps for iOS and Android allow users to browse, purchase, and download content on the go.
Integration with platforms like Google Ads and Facebook Ad Creator for seamless content use in advertising.
Shutterstock Studios offers custom content creation services for tailored visual solutions.
AI-powered tools for image editing and generative AI content creation using ethically sourced data.
The Shutterstock Contributor app enables artists to upload and monetize their creative work globally.

faqs.question: What types of content can I find on Shutterstock?
faqs.answer: Shutterstock offers royalty-free stock photos, videos, vectors, illustrations, 3D models, and music tracks for creative and commercial use.

faqs.question: Does Shutterstock offer a free plan or trial?
faqs.answer: Yes, Shutterstock provides a free trial allowing users to download select free stock photos and explore the platform’s features.

faqs.question: How does Shutterstock’s licensing work?
faqs.answer: Shutterstock offers straightforward royalty-free licensing, allowing use in various projects with options for subscriptions or à la carte purchases.

faqs.question: Can I contribute my own content to Shutterstock?
faqs.answer: Yes, artists can join as contributors via submit.shutterstock.com to upload and sell their photos, videos, or illustrations globally.

faqs.question: What are Shutterstock’s pricing options?
faqs.answer: Shutterstock offers subscription plans for regular downloads and à la carte purchases for single images or videos, with pricing details at x.ai/grok.

faqs.question: Does Shutterstock integrate with other platforms?
faqs.answer: Yes, Shutterstock integrates with tools like Google Ads, Facebook Ad Creator, and its API supports over 10,000 integrations for business use.

faqs.question: Is Shutterstock’s content suitable for commercial use?
faqs.answer: Shutterstock’s royalty-free content is licensed for commercial use in marketing, advertising, websites, and other professional projects.

faqs.question: What is Shutterstock Studios?
faqs.answer: Shutterstock Studios provides custom content creation services, producing tailored visuals for brands and creative projects.
